intro: Psychotria chalconeura var. montana, commonly known as the mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
